title: Heartwarming! UP Cop Carries Elderly Lady With Fractured Leg To Her Home After She Lost Her Way
text:
Heartwarming! UP Cop Carries Elderly Lady With Fractured Leg To Her Home After She Lost Her Way

Heartwarming! UP Cop Carries Elderly Lady With Fractured Leg To Her Home After She Lost Her Way

There may be a great deal of negativity surrounding men in khaki uniforms, but there are a few who have a set an example for humanity with their selfless deeds.

Like this Uttar Pradesh cop who went out of his way to help an injured elderly woman.

Saidpur station in-charge Jai Kishore Awasthi in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya was on his way to inspect 'puja pandals' and his heart sank when he spotted an elderly woman who seemed to have lost her way.

The woman was walking with fractured leg, and moved by what he saw, he got off the police car to lend a helping hand.

But the woman was terrified on seeing the cops halt in front of her and started apologising for anything that she did wrong.

Awasthi then tried to calm her down by saying that he was only trying to help and asked her explain what had happened.

The woman who looked well over 80 years said that her name was Phoolmati and she is a resident of Pahalwan Purwa village of Majre Lohati Saraiyan where she lives with her husband Kilaram, reports Times Now.

She told Awasthi and the others that she was unable to walk due to a fractured leg and had forgotten her way back home.

Awasthi took her into the police car and found. He then went out of his way and lifted her to her to home. A video of the same is doing rounds on social media platforms with users applauding the team of policemen from Uttar Pradesh for their selfless act of kindness.
